newsitem.title: PERU: Peru sees 1996 inflation at 11.1 pct to 11.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Peru sees 1996 inflation at 11.1 pct to 11.5 pct.

text.p: The Peruvian government estimated Monday accumulated 1996 consumer inflation would reach between 11.1 percent and 11.5 percent, up from 10.23 percent last year.

"If inflation in the month of December repeats the results of November (0.47 percent), or even if it fluctuates within a range of 0.6 to 0.9 percent, accumulated 1996 inflation would close around 11.1 percent to 11.5 percent," said Felix Murillo, head of the government's National Institute of Statistics and Information (INEI).

The INEI earlier announced that November inflation was 0.47 percent, down from 1.2 percent in the same month last year. Eleven-month accumulated inflation was 10.51 percent, up from 8.3 percent in the same period of 1995.
Accumulated inflation in the 12 months up to November was 11.9, the INEI said.
November's inflation figure was led by housing, fuel and electricity prices, which rose 1.8 percent.
